title: John Abbott King
text: John Abbott King (21 August 1883 – 9 August 1916) was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who won 12 caps as a number 8 between 1911 and 1913. During <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a> he served as a lance corporal with the <a href="King%27s%20Liverpool%20Regiment">King's Liverpool Regiment</a>, and was killed at the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Somme">Battle of the Somme</a> aged 32. He is one of the missing commemorated on the <a href="Thiepval%20Memorial">Thiepval Memorial</a>.
